glosses: To operate a wheeled vehicle; to drive, to ride.
To continue to happen, to go on, to last, to take a certain amount of time.

examples.translation: Is this going to last forever?

glosses: (of animals) To huddle before one and compel to move forward; to drive.

examples.text: Bir sıçrayışta arabaya atlayarak hayvanları sürdü.
examples.translation: He jumped into the cart in one leap and drove the animals.

glosses: To push forward, to send, to drive.

examples.text: Bu şartlar altında Rommel tüm tanklarını savaşa sürmek zorunda kaldı.
examples.translation: Under these circumstances Rommel was forced to send all of his tanks onto the battlefield.

glosses: (of a container or a cooking utensil) To hold over or to place on fire, a stove or in an oven.

examples.text: Matarayı ateşe sürdü, suyun kaynamasını bekledi.
examples.translation: He held the canteen over the fire, waited for it to boil.
Once the oven heats up, place the tray in the oven.

glosses: To cause to touch, to make touch.

examples.text: Yüzümü saçlarına sürmek için başımı eğdim.
examples.translation: I tilted my head to touch it to her hair.
Don't touch the screen with your hand, it leaves a mark.

glosses: To exile, send into exile, to expel, to cast out, to banish.

examples.text: Sultan IV. Murat, Hezarfen Ahmet Çelebi'yi uçuşundan sonra bir kese altın verip Cezayir'e sürdü.
examples.translation: After giving Hezarfen Ahmet Çelebi a pouch of golden coins, Sultan Murat IV exiled him to Algeria.

glosses: To spread something on a surface in a thin layer; to rub, to smear, to apply.

examples.text: Bir dilim ekmeğin üstüne tereyağ ile reçel sürdü ve afiyetle yedi.
examples.translation: She spread butter and jam on a slice of bread and ate it with gusto.

glosses: To put on the market; to put up for sale, to launch, to release, to make available for purchase.

examples.translation: The album was planned to be released to the market in spring.

glosses: To release money into circulation illegally; to utter.

examples.text: Tutuklanan zanlı sahte para sürmekten yargılanıyor.
examples.translation: The suspect arrested is being tried for releasing fake money.

glosses: To remain in a certain state or situation; to lead, to maintain.

examples.translation: to lead the life of a nomad

glosses: To turn over the soil to prepare a field for planting; to plough, to till.

examples.translation: The farmer was ploughing his field.

glosses: (of plants) To sprout, to germinate, to grow in size, to shoot forth, to grow roots, to strike roots.

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish سورمك (sürmek, “to drive before one, to drive away, to banish, to advance, to sell in open market, to continue, to rub on or against, to shoot out, to protrude”), from Old Anatolian Turkish [script needed] (sür-, “to drive away, to spend time, to go ahead, (for time) to elapse, to rub, to smear”), from Proto-Turkic *sǖr- (“to drive before one, to lead, to drive away”). Although, both senses "to drive, to banish" and "to rub" were originated from the same root, it was not until Old Anatolian Turkish era when the verb went through semantic expansion and took on the latter meaning and began to be used in the sense "to cast away disease or ugliness via balms, ointments or medicine".
Cognates
Azerbaijani sürmək (“to continue, to last”)
Bashkir һөрөү (höröw, “to exile, to plow”)
Chagatai [script needed] (sürmek, “to drive, to drive away, to plough land”)
Chuvash сирме (sirme, “to move away”)
Khakas сӱрерге (sürerge, “to drive, to chase, to expel”)
Kipchak [Arabic needed] (sür-, “to banish”)
Kyrgyz сүрүү (sürüü, “to move forward, to rub, to scrape”)
Southern Altai сӱрер (sürer, “to drive, to chase”)
Tatar сөрү (sörü, “to drive, to exile, to plow”)
Turkmen sürmek (“to drive, to smear, to daub”)
Tuvan сүрер (sürer, “to clean, to purify”)
Uyghur سۈرمەك (sürmek, “to move, to shift, to pursue, to chase, to spread, to smear, to apply”)
Uzbek surmoq (“to move, to propel, to rub”)
Yakut үүр (üür, “to drive, to expel”)
